details: “G” is the seventh letter of the modern English alphabet. It represents the voiced velar plosive /g/ as in 'goat' and also the soft /dʒ/ sound as in 'giraffe'. It was introduced in the Latin alphabet as a modification of 'C'.

wordsData.definition: a hardy domesticated ruminant animal with backward curving horns and a beard
wordsData.example: The goat climbed up the rocky hill.

wordsData.definition: a small round or oval fruit typically green, purple, or red, grown in clusters on vines
wordsData.example: She picked some juicy grapes from the vine.

wordsData.definition: a stringed musical instrument played by plucking or strumming
wordsData.example: He played a beautiful tune on his guitar.

wordsData.definition: the tallest living terrestrial animal with a very long neck and legs
wordsData.example: The giraffe reached up to eat leaves from the tree.

rhymes.name: G is for Goat (to the tune of 'Baa Baa Black Sheep')
content: Giddy goat, giddy goat, climbing up the hill,
Finding tasty grass, eating all his fill.
With a little beard and horns that curve,
He munches happily with lots of verve!

rhymes.name: G is for Grapes (to the tune of 'Twinkle Twinkle Little Star')
content: Grapes so purple, green, and red,
Plump and juicy, sweet to eat,
They make a lovely, healthy treat.
